snippet: Egypt’s upper house of Parliament named 50 new editors for state-owned newspapers on Wednesday, including several who appear to have Islamist leanings, raising concerns among journalists of Islamizing the press.
abstract: Egypt’s upper house of Parliament names 50 new editors for state-owned newspapers, including several who appear to have Islamist leanings, raising concerns among journalists that country is trying to control the media.
lead_paragraph: Egypt’s upper house of Parliament named 50 new editors for state-owned newspapers on Wednesday, including several who appear to have Islamist leanings, raising concerns among journalists of Islamizing the press.

headline.main: Egypt: Fears Rise over Media Control
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Fears Rise Over Media Control
